intro: Davallia tristis, commonly known as the maidenhair fern, is a species native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and Africa. It is characterized by its delicate, arching fronds with a distinctive, lacy appearance. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called sori on the underside of its leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and requires high humidity and well-draining soil. Davallia tristis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its elegant foliage.
